metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3188 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101 and Chrome OS before 38.0.2125.101 do not properly handle the interaction of IPC and Google V8, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors involving JSON data, related to improper parsing of an escaped index by ParseJsonObject in json-parser.h.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I didn't find a json-parser.h or ParseJsonObject via codesearch mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
